PM Modi, accompanied by Nitin Gadkari, Omar Abdullah, and others, inaugurates Z-Morh tunnel in J&K’s Sonamarg - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Inaugurates Z-Morh Tunnel in Sonamarg, J&K

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the strategic Z-Morh tunnel in Ganderbal’s Sonamarg area, highlighting its significance in connecting the region and boosting tourism.

  • The Z-Morh tunnel, 6.5 kilometers long, was constructed at a cost of ₹2,700 crore.
  • Modi emphasized that the tunnel will make Sonamarg a year-round tourist destination.
  • He acknowledged the sacrifices of workers, including those who lost their lives during construction.
  • The project connects Kashmir with Ladakh and will ease access during harsh weather.
  • Modi remains non-committal on the timeline for restoring Statehood to J&K.
“I salute the dedication of workers who braved harsh weather conditions and even risked their lives to complete this project,” said PM Modi.

In conclusion, the inauguration of the Z-Morh tunnel represents a significant step towards improving infrastructure and connectivity in Jammu and Kashmir, contributing to a new era of progress in the region.
newTitle: PM Modi Inaugurates Z-Morh Tunnel in Sonamarg, J&K

title: Budget 2025: Revised Income Tax Slabs, Higher Standard Deduction, Section 80C Limit Increase – Know Key Exp - News18
summary:
Budget 2025: Revised Income Tax Slabs, Higher Standard Deduction, Section 80C Limit Increase – Know Key Expectations

Date: January 13, 2025, Source: News18

As Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman prepares for the Budget 2025 announcements, significant changes to income tax are anticipated, primarily aimed at benefiting salaried individuals.

  • Increase in Standard Deduction: The standard deduction may increase from ₹50,000 to a maximum cap of ₹1 lakh.
  • Revised Income Tax Slabs: Speculation about changing the 30% tax rate to apply for income above ₹20 lakh for a fairer tax structure.
  • Senior Citizens’ Tax Reforms: Possible increases in exemption limits for taxpayers aged 60 and above.
  • Raising Section 80C Deduction Limit: Experts suggest increasing the deduction limit under Section 80C from ₹1.5 lakh to ₹3.5 lakh.
  • Possible Import Duty Hike on Gold: An increase in import duty on gold may be considered to address trade deficits.
“Budget 2025 aims to provide significant income tax relief for salaried individuals.”

Overall, these proposed changes could significantly impact taxpayers, potentially easing their financial burden as the cost of living continues to rise.
newTitle: Budget 2025: Key Changes in Income Tax Slabs and Deductions

summary:
Mahakumbh 2025 Live: Nearly 60 Lakh Take Holy Dip on Day 1; ‘Amrit Snan’ Scheduled for Tomorrow

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The 45-day Mahakumbh Mela 2025 commenced with nearly 60 lakh devotees participating in the holy dip at Triveni Sangam by 9:30 AM on day 1, with an expected attendance of over 40 crore devotees throughout the event.

  • The first major Shahi Snan, or Amrit Snan, will take place on January 14, 2025, coinciding with Makar Sankranti.
  • Significant measures are implemented for security, health, and traffic management.
  • Devotees from around the world gathered for this auspicious occasion, sharing their emotions and experiences.
“Maha Kumbh 2025 has begun today, with about 60 lakh people taking a holy dip. This year, it is a blend of faith and modernity.” - UP DGP Prashant Kumar

‘Raises doubts about your bona fides’: Delhi High Court raps AAP government over CAG report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi High Court Criticizes AAP Government for Delaying CAG Report Discussion

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi High Court has reprimanded the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government for mishandling a report from the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG), accusing it of delaying necessary discussions.

  • The court stated that the AAP government “dragged its feet” to prevent an assembly session from taking place.
  • Justice Sachin Datta highlighted that reports should have been promptly forwarded to the Speaker for discussion.
  • The Delhi government argued that upcoming elections hindered the holding of assembly sessions.
  • Seven BJP MLAs petitioned to table 14 CAG reports in the assembly, claiming their right to engage with the documents.
  • The court declined to immediately order a special assembly session, emphasizing the need for both parties to be heard first.
“The way you have dragged your feet raises doubts about your bona fides.” – Justice Sachin Datta

This judicial rebuke highlights concerns about government accountability and the implications for democratic processes leading up to elections.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Criticizes AAP Government for Delaying CAG Report Discussion

title: Why was Steve Jobs's wife not allowed to touch Shivling in Kashi? Seer answers - Hindustan Times
summary:
Why was Steve Jobs's wife not allowed to touch Shivling in Kashi? Seer answers

Publication Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Laurene Powell Jobs, wife of the late Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, visited the Kashi Vishwanath Temple but was not permitted to touch the Shivling due to temple traditions. Spiritual leader Swami Kailashanand Giri explained the strict protocols regarding non-Hindus touching the Shivling, highlighting her respect for Indian spirituality.

  • Laurene Powell Jobs visited the Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi.
  • She was not allowed to touch the Shivling as per temple protocols.
  • Swami Kailashanand Giri emphasized that he must uphold traditions.
  • Laurene participated in rituals, received prasad and a garland.
  • The Mahakumbh festival is expected to attract over 40 crore devotees.
“There is a tradition that anyone other than a Hindu cannot touch Kashi Vishwanath.” - Swami Kailashanand Giri Maharaj

In conclusion, Laurene Powell Jobs's visit to the Kashi Vishwanath Temple reflects her reverence for Indian culture while adhering to local traditions.
newTitle: Laurene Powell Jobs Respectfully Observes Kashi Vishwanath Temple Traditions

title: PM Modi inaugurates Z-Morh tunnel in J&K’s Sonamarg - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi inaugurates Z-Morh tunnel in J&K’s Sonamarg

Published on: January 13, 2025 by The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Z-Morh tunnel in Kashmir’s Ganderbal district, improving all-weather connectivity to the tourist destination of Sonmarg.

  • Inauguration took place on January 13, 2025, accompanied by key officials and ministers.
  • The tunnel is a strategic project that enhances road connectivity between Srinagar and Sonmarg.
  • Constructed at an altitude of over 8,650 feet, it bypasses landslide-prone areas.
  • The two-lane tunnel was built at a cost of over ₹2,700 crores.
“The tunnel provides all-weather road access to Sonmarg, which is vital for locals and tourists alike.”

The Z-Morh tunnel represents a significant engineering achievement, connecting critical geographical points in Jammu and Kashmir.
newTitle: PM Modi inaugurates Z-Morh tunnel in J&K’s Sonamarg

summary:
Delhi HC raps AAP govt over CAG report: 'The way you've been dragging your feet...'

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Delhi High Court criticized the Aam Aadmi Party government following a CAG report that highlighted irregularities in the Delhi excise policy.

  • The CAG report revealed significant lapses leading to a loss of approximately Rs 2,027 crore to the government.
  • The High Court questioned the AAP government about the delay in presenting the report in the Delhi Assembly.
  • The court emphasized the importance of being prompt in addressing such issues.
"The way you've been dragging your feet is something unfortunate. You should've been prompt in sending it (reports) to the speaker and having a discussion at the floor of the assembly," stated the court.

This criticism sheds light on the government's management of crucial financial oversight and accountability.

‘Situation sensitive but stable’: Army Chief on LAC disengagement, J-K infiltration bids - The Indian Express
summary:
‘Situation sensitive but stable’: Army chief on India-China disengagement along LAC

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi stated the situation along the India-China border is 'sensitive but stable', highlighting successful disengagement efforts and routine activities like patrolling in traditional areas. He assured that military readiness remains robust and focused on infrastructure development.

  • General Dwivedi confirmed patrolling and grazing has resumed in Depsang and Demchok.
  • The army chief emphasized a balanced and robust deployment along the LAC.
  • He discussed ongoing issues in Jammu and Kashmir, noting infiltration attempts from Pakistan continue despite a holding ceasefire.
  • The situation in Manipur is under control, although instances of violence persist.
“In the last year, 60 percent of the terrorists eliminated in Jammu and Kashmir were from Pakistan,” General Dwivedi.

In summary, the Army's approach involves both readiness for potential challenges and a commitment to resolving issues through local command.
newTitle: Army Chief Comments on India-China Border Situation

title: Thanks to early morning rains, Chennai breathes better on Bhogi day - DTNEXT
Situation tense but stable: Army Chief on border situation - The Hindu
summary:
Corps Commanders empowered to resolve issues at ground level: Army Chief on LAC situation

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi stated that all Corps Commanders have been authorized to resolve issues related to patrolling and grazing along the Line of Actual Control (LAC), describing the situation as sensitive but stable. Troop levels are not being reduced this winter.

  • Gen Dwivedi announced Corps Commanders' empowerment to address routine issues.
  • He emphasized the need for improved relations and resumption of trade points.
  • Verification patrols have verified disengagement in Eastern Ladakh.
  • Ceasefire with Pakistan remains intact, but terrorist infiltration continues.
  • Recent troop induction has helped reduce violence in Jammu and Kashmir.
“After April 2020, the trust between the two countries has to have a new definition.”

The Army is keen on future discussions to restore trust and manage sensitive borders effectively.
newTitle: Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi Discusses LAC Situation and Corps Commanders' Empowerment

title: Out of the terrorists eliminated last year, 60% were of Pakistan origin: Army Chief on border situation - The Hindu
summary:
Out of the terrorists eliminated last year, 60% were of Pakistan origin: Army Chief on border situation

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi addressed the press regarding the current situation along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) and various security challenges faced by the country.

  • The current situation along the LAC is noted as sensitive but stable with ongoing efforts required to build trust between Indian and Chinese forces.
  • Patrolling and grazing have resumed in traditional areas of Depsang and Demchok after disengagement.
  • 60% of terrorists eliminated in the last year were of Pakistani origin, highlighting ongoing infiltration attempts.
  • The ceasefire along the Line of Control with Pakistan is holding, despite ongoing threats.
  • In Manipur, security forces are working to control violence with proactive government initiatives.
“In the last year, 60% of terrorists eliminated were of Pakistan origin.” - Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi

In conclusion, the Army Chief emphasizes the need for continued vigilance and infrastructure development to address both international and domestic security challenges.
newTitle: Army Chief Reports Border Situation and Terrorism Trends

title: 'Prosecutrix's Testimony Doesn't Inspire Confidence' : Supreme Court Affirms Acquittal In Rape Case - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Upholds Acquittal in Controversial Rape Case

Date: January 07, 2025 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court ruled that a single witness's testimony, even that of the victim in a rape case, must inspire confidence for a conviction to occur. The court's decision came after an appeal against the acquittal of an accused who was previously charged with rape.

  • The prosecution alleged that the accused threatened the victim with a knife and assaulted her.
  • The Trial Court found insufficient evidence and acquitted the accused, a decision confirmed by the High Court.
  • The Supreme Court examined contradictions in the victim's statements and the lack of corroborative medical evidence.
  • The Court questioned the credibility of the victim's claim of being threatened and subsequently not raising an alarm.
“It is not believable that when the prosecutrix was caught by the accused who is known to the prosecutrix, she went with him quite a distance in the Bazaar and then to a shop...”

The Court ultimately dismissed the appeal, stating that the victim's testimony did not meet the necessary standards of confidence.
newTitle: Supreme Court Upholds Acquittal in Controversial Rape Case

title: Z-Morh tunnel: All you need to know - The Hindu
summary:
Z-Morh Tunnel: All you need to know

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Z-Morh tunnel in Ganderbal district, enhancing connectivity between Gagangir and Sonamarg, which will significantly ease access to Ladakh.

  • The tunnel is 6.5 km long and will improve summer travel to Ladakh.
  • Constructed at a cost of ₹2,400 crore, it ensures all-weather connectivity on the Srinagar-Leh highway.
  • Built at an altitude of 8,650 feet, it's designed for both civilian and military use.
  • The tunnel is equipped with modern technology for a secure travel experience.
  • This infrastructure project will boost tourism, especially winter tourism, in the Sonamarg region.
“The engineering marvel is a game changer for the region.” - National Highways and Infrastructure Development Corporation

This tunnel represents a significant step in improving strategic military access and facilitating year-round tourism, expected to enhance local economies and livelihoods.
newTitle: Z-Morh Tunnel: A Strategic Connectivity Game Changer

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Z-Morh tunnel: All you need to know - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi to inaugurate Z-Morh tunnel: All you need to know

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the strategically significant Z-Morh tunnel in Ganderbal district of Jammu and Kashmir, enhancing connectivity to Ladakh.

  • The 6.5 km tunnel connects Gagangir and Sonamarg, improving summer travel to Ladakh.
  • Constructed at a cost of ₹2,400 crore, the tunnel was opened in February 2024.
  • It enhances defense and civil connectivity between Srinagar and Sonamarg, especially during winter.
  • The tunnel aids tourism, making Sonamarg a year-round destination and boosting local economies.
  • Equipped with advanced technology for safety and real-time updates for users.
  • Significantly reduces travel time and increases vehicle handling capacity.
Omar Abdullah stated, “The Z-Morh tunnel will open Sonamarg to tourism all year round, potentially developing the town into a great ski destination.”

This project highlights the commitment to enhance infrastructure in the region, promising economic growth and improved accessibility.
newTitle: PM Modi to Inaugurate Z-Morh Tunnel: Key Details

title: Delhi weather: shivers in cold wave, dense fog disrupts flight and train operations; IMD issues ‘orange alert’ across NCR - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi weather: shivers in cold wave, dense fog disrupts flight and train operations; IMD issues ‘orange alert’ across NCR

Publication date: January 13, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has recorded a minimum temperature of 9.6 degrees Celsius in Delhi, disrupting flights and train operations due to dense fog.

  • The maximum temperature is expected to reach 19 degrees Celsius later today.
  • A total of 311 minutes delay reported for Purushottam Express due to fog.
  • The AQI was recorded at 274, indicating 'poor' air quality in the city.
  • Dense fog conditions are expected to continue, prompting an orange alert from the IMD.
“According to the CPCB, an AQI between 201 and 300 indicates poor air quality.”

In summary, the severe weather conditions have led to significant disruptions in transportation and have raised concerns about air quality in the national capital.
newTitle: Delhi Cold Wave Causes Disruptions in Flights and Trains; Orange Alert Issued
